trans-unit.source: Azure Multi-Factor Authentication Reports
trans-unit.target: Azure Multi-Factor Authentication Reports

trans-unit.source: This describes how to change user settings such as forcing the users to do the proof-up process again.
trans-unit.target: This describes how to change user settings such as forcing the users to do the proof-up process again.

trans-unit.source: Managing user settings with Azure Multi-Factor Authentication in the cloud
trans-unit.target: Managing user settings with Azure Multi-Factor Authentication in the cloud

trans-unit.source: As an administrator, you can manage the following user and device settings.
trans-unit.target: As an administrator, you can manage the following user and device settings.

trans-unit.source: Require selected users to provide contact methods again
trans-unit.target: Require selected users to provide contact methods again

trans-unit.source: Delete users existing app passwords
trans-unit.target: Delete users existing app passwords

trans-unit.source: Restore MFA on all suspended devices for a user (Public Preview)
trans-unit.target: Restore MFA on all suspended devices for a user (Public Preview)

trans-unit.source: This is helpful if a computer or device is lost or stolen or you need to remove a users access.
trans-unit.target: This is helpful if a computer or device is lost or stolen or you need to remove a users access.

trans-unit.source: Require selected users to provide contact methods again
trans-unit.target: Require selected users to provide contact methods again

trans-unit.source: This setting will forces the user to complete the registration process again when he or she signs in.
trans-unit.target: This setting will forces the user to complete the registration process again when he or she signs in.

trans-unit.source: Be aware that non-browser apps will continue to work if the user has app passwords for them.
trans-unit.target: Be aware that non-browser apps will continue to work if the user has app passwords for them.

trans-unit.source: You can delete the users app passwords by also selecting **Delete all existing app passwords generated by the selected users**.
trans-unit.target: You can delete the users app passwords by also selecting **Delete all existing app passwords generated by the selected users**.

trans-unit.source: How to require users to provide contact methods again
trans-unit.target: How to require users to provide contact methods again

trans-unit.source: Sign-in to the Azure Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: Sign-in to the Azure Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: On the left, click Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: On the left, click Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: Under, Directory click on the directory for the user you want to require to provide their contact method again.
trans-unit.target: Under, Directory click on the directory for the user you want to require to provide their contact method again.

trans-unit.source: At the top, click Users.
trans-unit.target: At the top, click Users.

trans-unit.source: At the bottom of the page, click Manage Multi-Factor Auth.
trans-unit.target: At the bottom of the page, click Manage Multi-Factor Auth.

trans-unit.source: This will open the multi-factor authentication page.
trans-unit.target: This will open the multi-factor authentication page.

trans-unit.source: Find the user that you wish to manage and place a check in the box located next to the name.
trans-unit.target: Find the user that you wish to manage and place a check in the box located next to the name.

trans-unit.source: You may need to change the view at the top.
trans-unit.target: You may need to change the view at the top.

trans-unit.source: This will bring up the **Manage user settings** link on the right.
trans-unit.target: This will bring up the **Manage user settings** link on the right.

trans-unit.source: Click it.
trans-unit.target: Click it.

trans-unit.source: Place a check in **require selected users to provide contact methods again**.
trans-unit.target: Place a check in **require selected users to provide contact methods again**.

trans-unit.source: Provide contact methods
trans-unit.target: Provide contact methods

trans-unit.source: Click save.
trans-unit.target: Click save.

trans-unit.source: Click close
trans-unit.target: Click close

trans-unit.source: Delete users existing app passwords
trans-unit.target: Delete users existing app passwords

trans-unit.source: This deletes all of the app passwords that a user has created.
trans-unit.target: This deletes all of the app passwords that a user has created.

trans-unit.source: Non-browser apps that were associated with these app passwords will cease to work until a new app password is created.
trans-unit.target: Non-browser apps that were associated with these app passwords will cease to work until a new app password is created.

trans-unit.source: How to delete users existing app passwords
trans-unit.target: How to delete users existing app passwords

trans-unit.source: Sign-in to the Azure Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: Sign-in to the Azure Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: On the left, click Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: On the left, click Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: Under, Directory click on the directory for the user you wish to delete app passwords for.
trans-unit.target: Under, Directory click on the directory for the user you wish to delete app passwords for.

trans-unit.source: At the top, click Users.
trans-unit.target: At the top, click Users.

trans-unit.source: At the bottom of the page, click Manage Multi-Factor Auth.
trans-unit.target: At the bottom of the page, click Manage Multi-Factor Auth.

trans-unit.source: This will open the multi-factor authentication page.
trans-unit.target: This will open the multi-factor authentication page.

trans-unit.source: Find the user that you wish to manage and place a check in the box located next to the name.
trans-unit.target: Find the user that you wish to manage and place a check in the box located next to the name.

trans-unit.source: You may need to change the view at the top.
trans-unit.target: You may need to change the view at the top.

trans-unit.source: This will bring up the **Manage user settings** link on the right.
trans-unit.target: This will bring up the **Manage user settings** link on the right.

trans-unit.source: Click it.
trans-unit.target: Click it.

trans-unit.source: Place a check in **delete all existing app passwords generated by the selected users**.
trans-unit.target: Place a check in **delete all existing app passwords generated by the selected users**.

trans-unit.source: Click save.
trans-unit.target: Click save.

trans-unit.source: Click close.
trans-unit.target: Click close.

trans-unit.source: Restore MFA on all suspended devices for a user
trans-unit.target: Restore MFA on all suspended devices for a user

trans-unit.source: Administrators have the ability to reset Multi-Factor Authentication on their devices and browsers.
trans-unit.target: Administrators have the ability to reset Multi-Factor Authentication on their devices and browsers.

trans-unit.source: This is done by restoring Multi-Factor Authentication for a user’s devices and browsers.
trans-unit.target: This is done by restoring Multi-Factor Authentication for a user’s devices and browsers.

trans-unit.source: When doing this, this will remove the suspension from all of the user’s devices and browsers.
trans-unit.target: When doing this, this will remove the suspension from all of the user’s devices and browsers.

trans-unit.source: How to restore MFA on all suspended devices for a user
trans-unit.target: How to restore MFA on all suspended devices for a user

trans-unit.source: Sign-in to the Azure Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: Sign-in to the Azure Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: On the left, click Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: On the left, click Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: Under, Directory click on the directory for the user you wish to restore mfa on.
trans-unit.target: Under, Directory click on the directory for the user you wish to restore mfa on.

trans-unit.source: At the top, click Users.
trans-unit.target: At the top, click Users.

trans-unit.source: At the bottom of the page, click Manage Multi-Factor Auth.
trans-unit.target: At the bottom of the page, click Manage Multi-Factor Auth.

trans-unit.source: This will open the multi-factor authentication page.
trans-unit.target: This will open the multi-factor authentication page.

trans-unit.source: Find the user that you wish to manage and place a check in the box located next to the name.
trans-unit.target: Find the user that you wish to manage and place a check in the box located next to the name.

trans-unit.source: You may need to change the view at the top.
trans-unit.target: You may need to change the view at the top.

trans-unit.source: This will bring up the **Manage user settings** link on the right.
trans-unit.target: This will bring up the **Manage user settings** link on the right.

trans-unit.source: Click it.
trans-unit.target: Click it.

trans-unit.source: Place a check in restore Multi-Factor Authentication on all suspended devices.
trans-unit.target: Place a check in restore Multi-Factor Authentication on all suspended devices.

trans-unit.source: Click save.
trans-unit.target: Click save.

trans-unit.source: Click close.
trans-unit.target: Click close.
